name: Web and Internet Functionality
description: A comprehensive set of features enabling the system to provide client-side and server-side web functionalities. It includes support for browsing the internet using Firefox, hosting web content through a web server, and running Java-based web applications with a web servlet engine.

name: Tiling Window Managers
description: This feature encompasses a collection of tiling window managers, which are lightweight, efficient, and designed to maximize productivity by organizing open application windows in a non-overlapping grid. These window managers support advanced customization and are ideal for power users and developers who prefer keyboard-driven workflows. The feature includes options supporting both Wayland and X11 protocols, with additional supplemental packages enhancing the functionality and integration of the core window managers. Sub-features include Sway, XMonad, and i3, each catering to specific use cases and user preferences.

name: Web Application Development Support
description: Provides a comprehensive environment to support the development of web applications using a variety of programming languages and frameworks. This feature includes tools and frameworks for PHP, Perl, Python, and Ruby, allowing developers to build, deploy, and manage web applications efficiently. The support spans from general-purpose scripting languages to more specialized web development stacks like Ruby on Rails, ensuring flexibility and scalability for diverse web development needs.

name: Identity and Directory Management
description: A comprehensive set of features for centralized identity and access management, integrating user, machine, and authentication services. This parent feature supports directory client and server functionalities, enterprise certificate authority services, domain membership capabilities, centralized identity management, and advanced authentication mechanisms such as smart card support. It is designed to streamline identity validation and directory integration across networks, enhancing both security and administrative efficiency.

name: Document Authoring and Text Processing
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and systems designed for creating, editing, formatting, and rendering textual and technical content. This parent feature encompasses a variety of functionalities such as document creation and publishing in specific formats like DocBook, support for internationalized text through input methods and fonts, advanced editing tools (including text editors), the TeX system for high-quality document formatting, and specialized tools for technical writing. These features collectively support the complete workflow from content creation to publication across different languages, scripts, and technical domains.

name: Programming Language Development and Integration Support
description: Comprehensive support for the development and integration of software using various programming languages. This feature provides the necessary tools, libraries, and interfaces to enable efficient development, testing, and deployment across multiple programming languages, including Haskell, OCaml, Perl, and Ruby. It encompasses both the core language support for coding and the integration of these languages with common libraries and functionality, ensuring a seamless development experience.

name: Virtualization Platform Support
description: A comprehensive feature set that encompasses packages, utilities, and drivers for supporting various virtualization platforms and hypervisors. This includes platform-specific components for Hyper-V, KVM, and VMware, along with a minimal installation option for hosting virtualization environments.

name: Scientific and System Development Toolkit
description: A comprehensive feature encompassing tools and functionalities for scientific computation, system-level operations, and software development infrastructure. This includes build systems for software compilation and management, simulators for neuron modeling and neural network analysis, and a diverse set of system tools providing essential utilities for system configuration, analysis, and management.

name: Critical Path and Robotics Framework
description: A comprehensive framework encompassing essential packages for critical path functionalities in both package building and deliverable composition, alongside a suite of tools and libraries specifically designed for robotics development. This parent feature unifies the underlying infrastructure for streamlined build processes and advanced robotics capabilities, ensuring a cohesive and modular environment for development and deployment.

name: Remote Access and Backup Tools
description: A set of tools and utilities designed to facilitate seamless interaction with remote systems and backup servers. This includes client tools for connecting to backup servers to perform data backups, as well as remote desktop clients for accessing and controlling remote machines. These tools are essential for managing and securing data, ensuring operational continuity, and enabling remote system administration.

name: Linux Installation Variants
description: A categorization of Linux installation options that defines various levels of functionality and resource usage. This parent feature encompasses different installation configurations ranging from the minimal core system to standard setups, allowing users to tailor the operating environment to their specific needs or constraints.

name: Critical Path Desktop Functionality
description: A comprehensive feature that encompasses the Critical Path functionality across multiple desktop environments. This parent feature includes a set of packages to provide essential system components and primary functionalities necessary for the smooth operation of the Critical Path in various Linux desktop environments, specifically Deepin, GNOME, KDE, LXDE, LXQt, and Xfce. By standardizing the Critical Path functionality across these desktop environments, this feature ensures consistent system behavior and operational integrity regardless of the user's preferred desktop environment.

name: Educational Tools and Learning Environments
description: A collection of software tools and environments designed to facilitate learning and education. This parent feature encompasses educational software for general learning purposes, specialized tools for teaching and learning Python programming, and interactive environments like the Sugar Desktop Environment that encourage educational exploration and creativity. These tools are aimed at enhancing the educational experience for students, teachers, and lifelong learners.

name: Development and Packaging Tools
description: A combined feature that integrates tools and utilities necessary for software development and packaging on Fedora. It includes PowerTools for accessing various development packages and Fedora Packager, which provides essential tools for building and managing Fedora packages.

name: Printing and Fabrication Tools
description: A comprehensive suite of software tools and utilities that enable users to facilitate both traditional printing tasks, such as sending documents to local or remote printers, and modern 3D fabrication processes, including preparing, slicing, and managing 3D printer workflows. This parent feature provides a unified approach to handling diverse printing needs, from standard office printing to advanced 3D manufacturing.

name: Deepin Desktop Ecosystem
description: The Deepin Desktop Ecosystem encompasses a complete suite of tools and components designed to provide an elegant, user-friendly, and fully integrated desktop experience. It includes the core Deepin Desktop Environment (DDE) for an intuitive and visually appealing workspace, a wide array of Deepin Desktop Applications tailored for productivity and ease of use, Deepin New Desktop Environment packaging that delivers cutting-edge software updates and enhancements, and specialized media packages optimized to enhance multimedia capabilities within the Deepin Desktop setup. Together, these elements work in harmony to provide a cohesive and enjoyable user experience.

name: Linux Installation and Initial Setup
description: A parent feature encompassing the essential components and processes required for Linux installation and initial system configuration. This includes the Critical Path functionality for streamlined package handling during installation with Anaconda, as well as initial setup utilities tailored for specific desktop environments, such as KDE Spin, to ensure a customized firstboot experience for users.

name: System Utilities and Accessibility Enhancements
description: This parent feature encompasses essential tools and features that enhance system management, accessibility, font design, and hardware compatibility. It brings together a diverse collection of functionalities aimed at improving system administration, user accessibility for desktop environments, font-related operations, and hardware support utilities. Specifically, it includes graphical administration tools, accessibility features for desktop environments, font design and packaging utilities, and tools for managing and supporting various hardware-specific requirements.

name: Java Runtime and Application Server Ecosystem
description: A comprehensive feature encompassing the tools, environments, and servers required for building, deploying, and running Java-based applications. This includes Java Development Kits (JDKs), application servers, and web application container technologies. Sub-features include Alibaba Dragonwell JDK for optimized Java runtime, Java Application Server for hosting enterprise-level applications, and Tomcat, a lightweight web application server for dynamic web content.

name: Enhanced GNOME Desktop Experience
description: A comprehensive and user-friendly GNOME-based desktop environment tailored for both general and specialized use cases. This feature encompasses a phone/tablet UX environment leveraging GNOME3 technologies, providing a seamless and intuitive experience for mobile and tablet devices. Additionally, it includes a collection of extra games designed specifically for the GNOME Desktop, enhancing entertainment options. At its core, the GNOME platform offers a highly intuitive, versatile, and user-friendly desktop environment suitable for a wide range of users.
children: Extra games for the GNOME Desktop

name: Advanced Network Traffic Management
description: Provides comprehensive capabilities for managing and optimizing network traffic and infrastructure. This feature encompasses functionalities for load balancing network traffic (both TCP/HTTP) using tools like HAProxy, support for distributing network load efficiently, and provisioning servers dedicated to core network protocols and services. It ensures reliable, scalable, and high-performance network operations.

name: Desktop Environment Multimedia Support
description: Comprehensive multimedia support for a variety of desktop environments, ensuring seamless playback and integration of audio, video, and other multimedia content. This feature encompasses multimedia capabilities specifically tailored for KDE, LXDE, LXQt, and Xfce, enabling a consistent media experience across different environments.

name: System Management Tools
description: An integrated suite of utilities designed to facilitate comprehensive system management tasks. This feature consolidates tools for monitoring hardware health, accessing mainframe computing resources, and configuring and analyzing computer networks. It provides system administrators with a centralized solution for efficient oversight and optimization of server hardware, mainframe accessibility, and network performance.

name: KDE Ecosystem
description: The KDE Ecosystem is a comprehensive suite of software built on the KDE framework. It includes the KDE Plasma Workspaces for desktop management, a robust set of KDE Applications for everyday usage, specialized KDE Educational applications for learning and teaching purposes, and KDE PIM tools for managing personal information efficiently. Together, these components form a cohesive environment designed to enhance user productivity, education, and personal organization.

name: Network Services
description: Provides the system with the capability to deliver and manage various network-based services, including communication, file transfers, distributed storage access, and resource sharing functionalities. This feature enables the system to interact with other systems and devices over a network by hosting or consuming services like e-mail, file transmission, network storage access, and printing services.

name: System Management Framework
description: A comprehensive feature that encompasses various tools and frameworks for administering and managing a system. This includes graphical tools for user-friendly management interfaces, headless tools for remote or command-line management without a graphical console, and foundational low-level hardware management frameworks to enable efficient control and configuration of system components.

name: OSTree and Visual Environment Support
description: A comprehensive feature grouping that encompasses support for OSTree-based systems and visual desktop enhancements. This includes required packages for Atomic Host and Workstation OSTree environments to ensure reliable system deployments and updates, as well as tools for enhanced visual effects and desktop customization through Compiz and Emerald.

name: Conflicts Management
description: This parent feature encompasses all sub-features related to managing package conflicts when performing an '@everything' installation across various Linux environment variants and repositories. It provides a centralized organizational structure for conflict handling to ensure compatibility and consistency across different system configurations and software sources. The sub-features address conflict groups specific to Client, ComputeNode, Server, and Workstation variants, as well as conflicts arising from the AppStream and BaseOS repositories during the '@everything' installation process.

name: Enhanced System Utility and Educational Support Tools
description: Includes a comprehensive set of tools and utilities aimed at enhancing system administration capabilities and providing additional educational activities for use in the Sugar environment. This feature ensures a well-rounded user experience by supporting both technical system management tasks and interactive learning modules.

name: Software Development and Cross-Platform Interoperability
description: This parent feature encompasses core functionalities for software application development and cross-platform file sharing. It includes essential development libraries needed to build and compile applications, along with functionality to facilitate seamless file sharing between Linux and Microsoft Windows systems.

name: LXQt Desktop Environment Ecosystem
description: A comprehensive collection of components and support tools for the LXQt Desktop Environment, encompassing both a suite of essential applications tailored for the desktop and extensive translations to enhance accessibility and usability across multiple languages.

name: Internet Communication and Services
description: This parent feature encompasses functionalities and tools that enable a system to facilitate internet-based communication and services, including both text-based and graphical applications for email, news server functionalities, and broader internet applications.

name: Software Development Environment
description: A comprehensive feature providing tools and support for creating, running, and managing software development projects. It includes a basic development environment, support for running Java applications, and tools for Java development.

name: Office Suite and Productivity Tools
description: A comprehensive category encompassing a variety of office suite and productivity applications designed for different desktop environments and general-purpose usage. This feature includes specialized and versatile office solutions such as Deepin Desktop Office for the Deepin Desktop Environment, LXQt Office tailored for the LXQt environment, and the standalone LibreOffice Productivity Suite. It provides tools for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, and other productivity-related tasks suitable for diverse user needs.

name: Scientific Computing and Analysis Toolkit
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and libraries designed to facilitate scientific research and analysis, leveraging the Python programming language. It encompasses utilities for conducting advanced mathematical computations, scientific modeling, and data analysis to support researchers and engineers in a wide range of scientific domains.

name: Development Tools and Libraries
description: A collection of features and resources essential for software development. This includes additional development headers, libraries required for building open-source applications, and extensible tools such as GNU Emacs for advanced editing and programming support.

name: Advanced Linux Toolkit Suite
description: A comprehensive collection of specialized toolkits designed to enhance Linux system management, performance optimization, and software deployment. This parent feature unifies various toolsets, including Anaconda Tools for system installation and software management, Anolis Toolkit for support and compatibility in enterprise environments, and Keentune Toolkit for automatic system performance tuning and optimization.

name: Desktop-Specific Application Sets
description: A collection of commonly used application sets tailored for specific Linux desktop environments, such as LXDE and Xfce. This ensures that users have access to pre-configured and optimized applications that align with the design philosophy and functionality of their chosen desktop environment.

name: Database Management Systems
description: A collection of tools, servers, and clients for managing, querying, and storing data within relational database systems. This feature encompasses various database platforms, such as Alibaba database products and MariaDB, providing both server and client capabilities for robust database solutions.

name: Network Server Features
description: This feature encompasses various network server capabilities, including support for both legacy protocols and modern network-based services. It provides packages to enable the configuration and management of servers for old network protocols such as rsh and telnet, as well as services for traditional network infrastructure components like DHCP servers, ensuring comprehensive network functionality.

name: Hardware Design and Development Tools
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and environments supporting hardware engineers in designing, simulating, and developing hardware systems. This parent feature integrates capabilities such as electronic design automation, circuit simulation, and specialized toolchains for niche hardware platforms like Milkymist.

name: X Window System and Legacy Font Support
description: Provides comprehensive support for the X Window System including development tools for creating graphical applications, as well as compatibility with older bitmap and vector font packages for rendering legacy fonts. This feature ensures a balance of modern development capabilities and backward compatibility for systems requiring traditional font formats.

name: Desktop Environment Office Suites
description: A category of office and productivity applications tailored for specific Linux desktop environments. This feature unifies office suite capabilities provided for KDE, LXDE, Xfce, and general office environments, supporting tasks such as document creation, spreadsheets, presentations, and other productivity needs.

name: Graphical Application Software Development
description: This feature encompasses all the tools, libraries, and packages required for developing graphical applications on various Linux desktop environments and frameworks. It provides support for GNOME, KDE, and Xfce environments, covering both GTK+ and Qt frameworks. Developers can leverage these packages to create, test, and build robust applications tailored to specific desktop ecosystems.

name: Infrastructure Management
description: Comprehensive tools and software designed to centralize the management of your infrastructure, including backup solutions and support for cloud computing environments. This feature encompasses the critical components needed to safeguard, maintain, and optimize physical and virtual infrastructure resources.

name: Cloud and Virtualization Management Feature Set
description: A comprehensive feature set encompassing tools and software for managing cloud-based environments, including servers, system images, bootloaders, and virtualization technologies. This parent feature includes support for deploying, configuring, and maintaining cloud infrastructure and virtualization instances, as well as offline management of virtual images and cloud-specific operational tools.

name: Linux Network and Remote Access Tools
description: A comprehensive set of tools and interfaces designed to facilitate network connectivity, internet access, and remote management in Linux environments. This parent feature integrates sub-features such as console-based internet tools for streamlined internet access, support for dial-up and WWAN connectivity for broader network options, and remote management interfaces to allow seamless administration and control of Linux systems over the network.

name: Database Management Systems
description: This feature encompasses support for database management systems, providing packages and tools required to install, configure, and manage databases. Supported systems include MariaDB (MySQL) and PostgreSQL, ensuring robust data storage, querying, and management capabilities for various applications.

name: Desktop Environment and Applications
description: A collection of desktop environments and their associated applications designed to provide users with traditional, intuitive, and functional graphical user interfaces. This includes desktop layouts with a classic feel and accompanying applications that integrate seamlessly with the environments, enabling a productive and user-friendly experience.

name: Linux Product Core Framework
description: A unified core framework encompassing the essential packages mandatory for various Linux product types, including client, compute node, server, and workstation. This parent feature ensures a consistent base configuration and functionality across different Linux product variants, catering to the specific needs of each environment while maintaining a cohesive core infrastructure.

name: User Experience and Productivity Suite
description: A comprehensive collection of tools and applications designed to enhance overall user experience on a Linux desktop system. This feature encompasses a diverse range of utilities, including popular GNOME applications for productivity and functionality, as well as games and entertainment options to support relaxation and leisure activities.

name: Cross-Platform Development Tools
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and libraries designed to support the development of cross-platform applications. This parent feature includes resources for building .NET, .NET Core, and D-based applications, leveraging the flexibility and performance of modern development ecosystems.

name: Graphical User Interface (GUI) Framework
description: This parent feature provides the foundational tools and support for enabling graphical user interfaces within Linux systems. It encompasses functionalities necessary for running, displaying, and managing graphical environments, including support for the X Window System, a core framework for GUI operations, and local X.org display servers for rendering graphical content on the local machine.

name: System Debugging and Performance Tools
description: A comprehensive suite of tools designed to assist with diagnosing, analyzing, and solving issues related to system and application performance. This feature encompasses debugging and performance optimization capabilities for a variety of use cases, including standard applications, graphical user interface environments, and large-scale systems. The tools provided enable developers and system administrators to identify bottlenecks, diagnose issues, and optimize performance across diverse system configurations.

name: Enterprise Storage and High Availability
description: This feature encompasses a comprehensive suite of capabilities designed to provide robust, highly available, and scalable storage and networking solutions for enterprise environments. It includes support for CIFS file and storage servers, infrastructure for highly available services and shared storage, high-performance InfiniBand and RDMA-based fabrics for clustering and grid connectivity, and resilient clustered storage for fault-tolerant data management.

name: Critical Path Management
description: A comprehensive feature that encompasses all components and packages identified as 'Critical Path' across various categories, including applications, the base platform, server edition, and standard-specific functionalities. This parent feature ensures that critical dependencies and applications essential for functional and performance integrity across different system spins and editions are identified, tracked, and managed cohesively.

name: Graphics Design and Editing Tools
description: Comprehensive tools and applications for creating, editing, and manipulating visual graphics, including still images, illustrations, and other design assets. This feature encompasses a diverse range of software solutions that support artists, designers, and general users in crafting digital graphics for various use cases such as digital art, photo editing, graphic design, and media creation.

name: Customizable Desktop Environment
description: A flexible and modular desktop environment that offers a basic X Window System and allows users to choose and configure their preferred window managers, including standalone window managers or integrations with specific desktop environments like MATE with XMonad. This feature empowers users to customize their desktop experience to match their workflow and preferences seamlessly.

name: Virtualization Environment
description: Provides comprehensive virtualization capabilities including headless and graphical environments, as well as tools for managing, controlling, and interfacing with virtualized guests and containers. This feature encompasses the necessary components to enable flexible virtualization solutions across different use cases.

name: Security and Auditing Tools
description: A comprehensive set of tools and utilities that support security auditing, integrity verification, and trust analysis. This feature offers a streamlined environment for performing advanced security assessments and ensuring system integrity through dedicated tools designed for monitoring, analysis, and verification.

name: Multimedia Framework and Applications
description: A comprehensive framework and set of tools for managing and delivering multimedia content, including audio and video processing, playback, recording, and streaming. This parent feature encompasses a range of functionalities, from audio/video frameworks for desktop environments to specialized applications for CD/DVD playback, multimedia file handling, and cross-platform media streaming. It serves as a unifying foundation for seamless multimedia experiences across systems and platforms.

name: Audio Tools and Production Environment
description: This feature encompasses a comprehensive suite of tools and environments designed for audio synthesis, editing, music production, and sound design. It includes capabilities for creating, mixing, and editing audio, offering a seamless workflow for audio professionals and enthusiasts. The feature supports various use cases such as digital audio workstation (DAW) capabilities, virtual instruments, sound manipulation, and advanced audio effect processing.

name: Guest System Integration Tools
description: A collection of tools and agents designed to enhance the functionality, performance, and manageability of systems running as virtualized guests under a hypervisor. This includes both general-purpose guest agents for system management and monitoring, as well as specialized desktop agents tailored for virtualized desktop environments.

name: Cross-Platform and Legacy Compatibility
description: A comprehensive feature designed to provide support for application development and compatibility across multiple platforms and legacy environments. This feature encompasses tools and libraries for ensuring seamless interaction with older Linux versions, legacy UNIX systems, and non-Linux platforms such as 32-bit Windows targets. It also includes development resources tailored for building and maintaining robust, forward-compatible Linux applications.

name: Network Services
description: This feature group encompasses tools and configurations required to enable essential network-based services on the system, including DNS name resolution and email communication functionalities. It facilitates the setup of a DNS name server for domain management and mail servers for handling email protocols such as IMAP and SMTP.

name: Containerization and Orchestration
description: Comprehensive tools and utilities for managing Linux containers, including key container platforms like Docker, Kubernetes (k8s), and related container management frameworks. This feature ensures streamlined deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications in Linux environments.

name: Linux Desktop Environments and Ecosystems
description: A collection of distinct Linux desktop environments and their associated ecosystems, providing users with various feature sets, applications, and designs to cater to different needs and preferences. This feature encompasses lightweight, feature-rich, and customizable desktops as well as the recommended applications that enhance their usability and experience.

name: Lightweight Desktop Environments
description: A category of desktop environments designed to be lightweight and resource-efficient, enabling smooth performance on computers with low hardware specifications, such as netbooks or older devices. These environments prioritize simplicity, speed, and reduced system requirements while providing essential desktop functionalities.

name: graphical-session-support
description: Provides essential components and common packages required to enable graphical environments. This feature acts as the foundation for initiating and managing any graphical session, ensuring compatibility and functionality across diverse graphical desktop environments.

name: Hardware Optimization and Support Tools
description: This parent feature encompasses a set of targeted tools and utilities designed to enhance hardware compatibility and support for server systems. It includes functionality specifically tailored to facilitate uncommon or specialized hardware configurations, ensuring efficient operations and robust performance in diverse server environments.

name: Creative and Development Tools
description: A set of packages and tools designed to support professional workflows for creative designers and developers. This feature includes packages for professional design tasks as well as tools for developing and customizing LibreOffice, such as creating extensions or macros.

name: Graphical System Compatibility Layer
description: A feature that provides compatibility and support for transitioning from or interoperating with legacy graphical systems, including utilities and functionalities necessary to integrate with the X Window System environment. This layer ensures backward compatibility for applications and workflows that rely on the legacy X Window System interface during migration or hybrid operational use.

name: System Networking and Server Configuration Tools
description: This parent feature encompasses essential tools and modules for managing network configurations and server setups. It includes NetworkManager submodules commonly used for networking functionalities and Red Hat's tailored solutions for server configuration. Together, these tools enable efficient setup, management, and optimization of both network and server environments.

name: Java Platform Integration
description: Comprehensive support for Java on Linux Server and Desktop platforms, ensuring compatibility, performance, and seamless integration of Java-based applications and development tools.

name: Enhanced Xfce Panel Customization
description: A comprehensive feature that provides users with the ability to extend and customize the functionality of the Xfce panel through additional plugins. This feature encompasses all enhancements designed to improve the flexibility, usability, and adaptability of the Xfce panel, enabling users to tailor their desktop experience by adding extra tools, utilities, and widgets.
children: Extra plugins for the Xfce panel

name: Virtualization Environment with Enhanced Networking
description: This feature encompasses the foundational tools and integrations needed to set up and manage virtualization environments with advanced networking capabilities. It includes support for Vagrant with the libvirt provider, enabling developers to create and manage virtualized environments efficiently, and also includes the installation of Open vSwitch (OVS), a powerful multilayer software switch used to support advanced networking features in virtualized setups.

name: Relational Database System
description: A comprehensive feature that encompasses implementations and tools for relational database management systems, including client and server components for managing, querying, and interacting with structured data. It covers both PostgreSQL ecosystem components and compatible open-source alternatives like openGauss.

name: Printing System Support
description: This feature provides the necessary tools and capabilities to enable the system to handle printing tasks efficiently. It includes support for printing operations, managing printers, and configuring the system to act as a print server for networked environments.

name: Technical Computing and Visualization
description: This parent feature encompasses tools and packages that support engineering, scientific, and graphical workflows. It includes functionalities for performing mathematical and scientific computations, creating plots and visualizations, as well as manipulating and scanning images, enabling users to process, analyze, and represent data effectively.

name: Development Tools and Libraries
description: A comprehensive set of tools and libraries designed to support software development and package management in Linux environments. This feature includes utilities for C programming, build automation, and RPM package creation, providing essential functionality for compiling, configuring, and building software projects.
